an4.24:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāketa, in Kāḷaka’s monastery.
an4.24:4.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
an4.24:5.1: In this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—whatever is seen, heard, thought, cognized, searched, and explored by the mind: that I know.
an4.24:6.1: In this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—whatever is seen, heard, thought, cognized, searched, and explored by the mind: that I have insight into.
an4.24:6.2: That has been known by a Realized One, but a Realized One is not subject to it.
an4.24:7.1: If I was to say that ‘I do not know … the world with its gods’, I would be lying.
an4.24:8.1: If I was to say that ‘I both know and do not know … the world with its gods’, that would be just the same.
an4.24:9.1: If I was to say that ‘I neither know nor do not know … the world with its gods’, that would be my fault.
an4.24:10.1: So a Realized One sees what’s to be seen, but does not conceive what’s seen, does not conceive what’s unseen, does not conceive what’s to be seen, and does not conceive a seer.
an4.24:10.2: He hears what’s to be heard, but does not conceive what’s heard, does not conceive what’s unheard, does not conceive what’s to be heard, and does not conceive a hearer.
an4.24:10.3: He thinks what’s to be thought, but does not conceive what’s thought, does not conceive what’s not thought, does not conceive what’s to be thought, and does not conceive a thinker.
an4.24:10.4: He knows what’s to be known, but does not conceive what’s known, does not conceive what’s unknown, does not conceive what’s to be known, and does not conceive a knower.
an4.24:10.5: Since a Realized One is poised in the midst of things seen, heard, thought, and known, he is the poised one.
an4.24:10.6: And I say that there is no-one who has better or superior poise than this.”
an4.24:11.1: “The poised one does not take anything
an4.24:11.2: seen, heard, or thought to be ultimately true or false.
an4.24:11.3: But others get attached, thinking it’s the truth,
an4.24:12.1: Since they’ve already seen this dart,
an4.24:12.2: to which people are attached and cling,
an4.24:12.3: they say, ‘I know, I see, that’s how it is’;
an4.24:12.4: the Realized Ones have no attachments.”
